BacTeria, obTained from homogenaTes of Tubularia hydranThs, were grown
on agar slanTs. The slanTs were prepared as a Three percEURnT soluTion of agar
in coelenTeraTe inTusion broTh. The slanTs were incubaTed unTil a good growTh
of bacTeria was obTained. The bacTerial growTh was Then emulsified in sTerile
filTered sea waTer. This emulsion was Then used To innoculaTe various volumes
of sTerile infusion broTh. The broTh culTures were incubaTed aT l8?C Tor a
period of 52 To 72 hours. The culTures were Then cenTriTuged and filTered via
a millipore filTer To remove The bacTeria. The resulTing clear filTraTe was Then
auToclaved. STerile Technique was used ThroughouT The experimenTs. STrepTomycin
52 l0'5 gram/ml) was used in all soluTions To prevenT bacTerial growTh.
STerile broTh conTaining sTrepTomycin served as a conTrol for The bacTerial
TilTraTe.
ln all cases, The bacTerial filTraTe inhibiTed regeneraTion oT
Tubwlaria sTems. The inhibiTed sTems exhibiTed Three specific anomolies: l)
clumping of The red pigmenT aT The disTal end; 2) bleb formaTion aT The disTal
end; and 3) consTricTion prior To disTal TenTacle formaTion. The inhibiTor
derived from The bacTerial culTures was sTable To: l) auToclaving: 2) millipore
TilTraTion: 3) refrigeraTion aT 400. The filTraTe losT all inhibiTory power afTer
dialysis againsT running sea waTer Tor 24 hours. The inhibiTor could noT be
absorbed onTo NoriTe The filTraTe was inhibiTory To all sTages up To
proximal ridge TormaTion. The pH of all soluTions was checked aT The beginning
and end of each experimenT and was Tound noT To vary more Than 0.5 pH uniT from
normal sea waTer (pH 
These resulTs in no way rule ouT The possibiliTy of specific
inhibiTors buT merely demonsTraTe ThaT wiThouT sTerile preparaTions, bacTeria
can produce an inhibiTor or inhibiTors which could overshadow of
specific inhibiTors.
SKALKO, RICHARD G. The effecT of Sfbromoyracil and aminopTerin on The
QevelopmenT of Arbacia DuncTulaTa
A varieTy of compounds which are anTi-meTabo|iTes of DNA have
been shown To produce malformaTions in verTebraTe embryonic sysTems. This invesTi-
gaTion was underTaken To deTermine if such agenTs had a specific effecT on
echinoderm developmenT.
Eggs and sperm were obTained from maTure Arbacia by mild elecTrical shock
AliquoTs (200-300) of eggs were added To sTender dishes 30 minuTes afTer ferTiliza
Tion and were allowed To develop in a consTanT-TemperaTure incubaTor 
ObservaTions were made periodically Through cleavage, aT haTching (l0-I2 hours),
aT prism or pre-pluTeus sTage (20-22 hours), and aT The maTure plufeus sTage (l6-
48 hours). All compounds used were dissolved in filTered sea waTer and, in all
experimenTs, The eggs were added To I0 ml. of soluTion.
AT all concenTraTions of 5-Bromouracil used (l-50 ug/ I0 ml. of filTered
sea waTer), This compound had no effecT on cleavage, blasTula formaTion or gasTru-
laTion ThaT was diiferenT from effecTs observed in conTrol culTures. A concenTra-
Tion of 20 ug/lO ml. reTarded developmenT aT The pre-pluTeus sTage in 80% of The
organisms. This eTfecT could be parTially overcome wiTh Time or by The addiTion
of Thymine To The culTure aT eiTher The four-cell sTage or aT haTching. AT higher
concenTraTions (30 and 50 ug/l0 boTh prepluTei and immaTure pluTei were
presenT aT 48 hours. This eTfecT, while noT as pronounced, was also parTially
overcome wiTh Time.
